item.title: 高盛称中国可能对乙烷和液化石油气免征高额关税
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：China, the world’s dominant plastics producer, could exempt imports of petrochemical feedstocks ethane and liquefied petroleum gas from tariffs should talks with the US prove positive, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said.】

item.title: 印度财报下调考验多头决心
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 应对关税影响，中国加大注资力度
item.description: 中国央行正在通过其政策工具之一加大现金注入力度，以保护世界第二大经济体免受美国惩罚性关税的影响。【原文：China’s central bank is boosting cash injection via one of its policy tools as it seeks to safeguard the world’s second-largest economy from the impact of punitive US tariffs.】

item.title: 中国人工智能初创企业 Manus 获得 5 亿美元融资
item.description: Manus AI 背后的中国初创公司获得了由美国风险投资公司 Benchmark 领投的一轮融资，这笔资金将用于探索使用人工智能代理来替代日常工作。【原文：The Chinese startup behind Manus AI secured a round of financing led by US venture firm Benchmark, scoring capital to explore the use of artificial intelligence agents to replace everyday tasks.】

item.title: 中资银行、汇丰银行和渣打银行前景将受美国关税影响
item.description: 中国工商银行股份有限公司、中国建设银行股份有限公司、中国农业银行股份有限公司和中国银行股份有限公司等中国贷款机构将公布财报，因为中美贸易战有可能侵蚀它们的利润率。【原文：Chinese lenders including Industrial & Commercial Bank of China Ltd., China Construction Bank Corp., Agricultural Bank of China Ltd. and Bank of China Ltd. will report earnings as the US-China trade war threatens to erode their margins.】

item.title: 中国人民银行潘功胜重申货币政策将保持适度宽松
item.description: 中国央行行长在华盛顿举行的20国集团会议上表示，中国经济今年开局良好，正继续保持上升趋势，并重申了此前关于实施适度宽松货币政策以支持经济增长的承诺。【原文：China’s economy began the year well and is continuing an upward trend, the central bank’s head said at the Group of 20 meeting in Washington, repeating earlier promises to implement a moderately loose monetary policy to support growth.】

item.title: 信实获得自 2008 年以来最多的 "买入 "评级
item.description: 卖方分析师是自 2008 年以来最看好信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.）的分析师，这反映出他们对周五晚些时候发布的财报前景看好。【原文：Sell-side analysts are the most bullish on Reliance Industries Ltd. since 2008, reflecting optimism for a better outlook ahead of earnings due later Friday.】

item.title: 香港养老基金资产在四月大跌中减少 56 亿美元
item.description: 贸易战升级重创全球股市后，香港公共养老基金本月将出现约 434 亿港元（56 亿美元）的纸面亏损。【原文：Hong Kong’s public pension fund is on track for a paper loss of about HK$43.4 billion ($5.6 billion) this month after the escalating trade war hammered global stocks.】

item.title: 特斯拉 Cybertuck 车祸受害者的父亲就死亡提起诉讼
item.description: 在加州 Cybertruck 车祸中丧生的三名大学生之一的家人提起诉讼，希望获得特斯拉公司卡车的使用权，并更好地了解他们女儿的死因。【原文：The family of one of three college students who died in a Cybertruck crash in California filed a lawsuit in a bid to gain access to the Tesla Inc. truck and better understand how their daughter died.】

item.title: 新加坡房价涨幅超过投票前预期
item.description: 新加坡第一季度私人住宅价格的涨幅超过了最初的估计，这表明尽管预期会出现不利因素，但市场需求仍在持续。【原文：Singapore private home prices rose more than initially estimated in the first quarter, in a sign of continued demand in the market despite expectations of headwinds.】

item.title: 比亚迪财报或将推动股价进一步上涨 对抗特斯拉
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪公司的第一季度财报预计将为 2025 年开了个好头，这可能会再次提振比亚迪股价。【原文：BYD Co. shares’ strong lead over Tesla Inc. this year may get another lift from the Chinese electric vehicle maker’s first-quarter results, expected to show a solid start to 2025.】

item.title: 京东外卖与美团外卖冲突或加剧 700 亿美元大战
item.description: 当全世界都在关注动荡的国际贸易战时，中国最大的两家互联网公司却在国内给对方造成了更大的伤害。【原文：While much of the world is focused on a volatile international trade war, two of China’s largest internet companies are inflicting greater damage on each other at home.】

item.title: 路由器制造商 TP-Link 面临美国反垄断刑事调查
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国正在对 TP-Link Systems Inc.【原文：The US is conducting a criminal antitrust investigation into pricing strategies by TP-Link Systems Inc., a California-based router maker with links to China whose equipment now dominates the American market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 东京物价创两年来最大涨幅，支持日本央行加息路径
item.description: 东京的通胀率较上月有所上升，达到两年来的最快速度，为日本央行的加息立场提供了支持。【原文：The pace of inflation in Tokyo picked up from the previous month to the fastest pace in two years, supporting the Bank of Japan’s rate-hike stance that is now complicated by uncertainty stemming from US tariff measures.】

item.title: 关注中美贸易不确定性，石油将出现周度下跌
item.description: 由于投资者权衡中美贸易之间相互矛盾的信息，原油每周都在下跌，这给正在努力应对唐纳德-特朗普总统关税影响的全球市场增添了不确定性。【原文：Oil headed for a weekly decline as investors weighed conflicting messages around trade between the US and China, adding uncertainty to global markets grappling with the fallout from President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: SpaceX 投资为 Alphabet 带来 80 亿美元利润增长
item.description: Alphabet 公司表示，其第一季度利润因投资一家私营公司而获得的 80 亿美元未实现收益而有所增长。据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，这家公司就是埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（Space Exploration Technologies Corp.【原文：Alphabet Inc. said its first-quarter profit was boosted by $8 billion in unrealized gains from an investment in a private company. That company is Elon Musk’s Space Exploration Technologies Corp., according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 向特朗普友好的阿根廷提供贷款有悖于国际货币基金组织董事会的担忧
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）最近向阿根廷提供巨额贷款--这个连续拖欠贷款的国家现在由唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的亲密盟友领导--引起了基金组织许多高层决策者的警惕。但它还是获得了绿灯。【原文：The IMF’s latest jumbo loan to Argentina – a serial defaulter now led by a close Donald Trump ally – raised red flags for many of the Fund’s top decision-makers. It got a green light anyway.】

item.title: 特朗普挑起贸易战，黄金热席卷中国
item.description: 黄金创纪录的涨势在中国掀起了更大的波澜，刺激了零售需求，激发了空前的交易量，加剧了波动，并引起了当局的警告。【原文：Gold’s record-setting rally is making ever-larger waves in China by stoking retail demand, fanning unprecedented volumes, feeding volatility, and drawing warnings from the authorities.】

item.title: 散蜘蛛黑客嫌疑人从西班牙引渡回美国
item.description: 据美国司法部官员称，一名被指控为臭名昭著的 "散蜘蛛"（Scattered Spider）网络犯罪集团成员的人已于周三从西班牙被引渡回美国。【原文：An alleged member of the notorious Scattered Spider cybercrime group was extradited from Spain to the US on Wednesday, according to a Department of Justice official.】

item.title: 特朗普发动贸易战，英国信心降至工党执政时期最低点
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策和不断上涨的国内账单使英国家庭信心降至工党政府执政以来的最低水平。【原文：Donald Trump’s tariffs and a barrage of rising domestic bills sent UK household confidence to its lowest level since the Labour government came to power.】

item.title: 马斯克出售 X 公司债务的新财务数据显示公司正在发生变化
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 控股公司（X Holdings Corp.【原文：Elon Musk’s X Holdings Corp. is evolving from a social media platform powered by mainstream advertisers to one betting on dollars generated from artificial intelligence and subscriptions — a change that appears to have buoyed its revenue lately.】

item.title: 加藤称贝森特会谈未讨论货币目标
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）表示，在周四与美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）的会谈中根本没有提到具体的外汇目标，但他强烈敦促美国重新考虑其关税措施。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said that specific foreign-exchange targets didn’t at all come up in his talks Thursday with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, while he did strongly urge that the US rethink its steps on tariffs.】

item.title: 受美联储和 Alphabet 影响，亚洲股市将高开：市场综述
item.description: 周五，亚洲股市准备高开，因为对美联储比预期更早削减互联网利率的乐观情绪推动了美国股市的反弹，而且 Alphabet 公司公布了稳健的盈利报告。【原文：Asian shares were poised to open higher Friday after optimism about the Federal Reserve cutting internet rates sooner than anticipated powered a rally in US stocks and Alphabet Inc. reported solid earnings.】

item.title: 悲伤的父母游行至纽约 Meta 公司总部，要求改变现状
item.description: 他们谈到了自己孩子的死因，有的年仅 11 岁，有的死于网络欺凌，有的死于掺有芬太尼的药片，有的死于色情短信诈骗，还有的死于美化自杀的内容。【原文：They spoke about the deaths of their children — some as young as 11 — to cyberbullying, pills laced with fentanyl, sextortion scams and suicide-glorifying content.】

item.title: 贸易战使美国石油天然气货物远离中国
item.description: 由于世界上最大的两个经济体之间的贸易战愈演愈烈，从美国运往中国的多种石油基气体运输工具已开始转向其他国家。【原文：Multiple carriers of petroleum-based gases traveling from the US to China have begun diverting to other countries due to the intensifying trade war between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 投资公司 Axonic Capital 据称将探索战略选择
item.description: 据知情人士透露，投资于抵押贷款支持证券和其他结构性产品的 Axonic Capital 公司正在探索战略选择，包括出售控股权。【原文：Axonic Capital, a firm that invests in mortgage-backed securities and other structured products, is exploring strategic options including the sale of a controlling stake, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 如果谷歌被迫出售浏览器，雅虎准备收购 Chrome 浏览器
item.description: 一位高级管理人员说，如果联邦法院命令谷歌剥离 Chrome 浏览器，作为对谷歌维持非法垄断的补救措施，那么由其所有者阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Internet company Yahoo Inc. — backed by owner Apollo Global Management Inc. — would bid for the Chrome web browser if a federal court orders Google to divest it as a remedy for maintaining an illegal monopoly, a senior executive said.】

item.title: 赫兹希望在支付诉讼费用前筹集 5 亿美元债务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，赫兹全球控股公司（Hertz Global Holdings Inc.【原文：Hertz Global Holdings Inc. is looking to raise around $500 million of secured debt to shore up its balance sheet, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】
